Welcome to #rome-adventure! This is the start of the #rome-adventure channel.
Dm (Rome) BOT 10-10-2023 16:00
The place the stranger told you to meet him turns out to be an empty hunter's cabin. The man approached each of you separately over the past few days, and told you to meet him here this morning. He talked about bringing the sun to Barovia, and needing experienced adventurers to infiltrate an ancient temple for that. As you all converge on the cabin, the man is nowhere to be seen yet. While the cabin looks completely empty, it doesn't seem abandoned. Everything is clean and well maintained, yet there are no personal belongings outside, nor any firewood in the open shed outside.
MacOonnie BOT 10-10-2023 17:37
The sun was a complicated topic for Mac, it was something that since turning, he had only seen a number of times countable on one paw, amazingly also, very recently after the ritual he had helped with in the grove... after which he had not felt at all healthy... as healthy as you can as an undead. But, as a vampire, he also knew the power of the sun more than most; you never know how much you'll miss something until it's gone. And to feel the touch if the warm rays that used to shine down on him, that know wracks his every fibre with pain, was something that he missed about being alive. It wasn't the same for Mina, she was a bat, nocturnal, without the same connection to the sun that a creature born under had, although his new self had been born even further away from it, six feet underground. As the others arrive he turns to them, "Some of you I know, some of you I don't, but of you are here you are here for a good cause, for something we all know is important. I may be vampire, but, where I'm from the master of those lands, my masters, he is not an evil tyrant like Strahd, he has not become so unattached from life in undeath. Our flock out there, everyone is looked after, and he opens the sky to all of them at certain time, during certain events. For hope, for vitamin D, for just that feeling of being alive that I recognise is so important, we do this. The people here, under Strahd's thumb, it is long past do that we world to alleviate their suffering. No wonder Strahd is so stunted emotionally when all he eats are people starved of food and vitamins, starved if freedom and sunlight, starved of emotion; I tell you their blood must be... unpleasant to say the least. They need our help, they need hope, and if Strahd is not going to grant it we will do all we can to provide any sort of respite, no matter how brief. Now, does anyone have any sunscreen?"
